description: The Rajiv Gandhi Swavlamban Rojgar Yojna in Delhi promotes self-employment by providing financial assistance through loans and subsidies to unemployed youth and entrepreneurs for setting up small businesses or enterprises.
key_features: Support for unemployed youth and entrepreneurs

benefits.loan_amount: Up to Rs. 3 Lakhs for business setup
benefits.subsidy: 25% subsidy on the loan amount, max Rs. 75,000

residency_criteria: Must be a resident of Delhi
business_criteria: Proposed business must be viable and located in Delhi

eligible_activities: Setting up small businesses in manufacturing, services, or retail
Purchase of equipment or raw materials

steps: Obtain the application form from the Delhi Khadi and Village Industries Board (DKVIB)
Submit a detailed business plan with the application
Attach required documents, including Aadhaar and residency proof
Applications are reviewed by the DKVIB
Approved applicants receive loans and subsidies
application_process.note: Applicants may need to attend an interview or training session

special_notes: The loan is provided through designated banks with DKVIB support
Subsidy is disbursed after loan sanction
Beneficiaries must comply with DKVIB guidelines
